title: About / CV
text:
I’m a PhD candidate in Quantitative Research Methods in Education at the University of Oregon (specialization: Educational Data Science) and a Research Analyst at CRPE. My work focuses on how race and language shape educational opportunity through policy labels and the systems that translate labels into course access and learning experiences. :contentReferenceoaicite:22
Download: CV (PDF)

title: About / CV
text:
I’m a PhD candidate in Quantitative Research Methods in Education at the University of Oregon (specialization: Educational Data Science) and a Research Analyst at CRPE. My work focuses on how race and language shape educational opportunity through policy labels and the systems that translate labels into course access and learning experiences. :contentReferenceoaicite:22

title: About / CV
text:
Research interests

Multilingual learners and educational opportunity
TAG identification, advanced coursework, and access
Policy implementation and equity
Critical approaches to quantitative and mixed methods (QuantCrit)
Student-centered innovation and open data products :contentReferenceoaicite:23

Headshot

title: Janette Avelar
text:
PhD Candidate (Quantitative Research Methods in Education), University of Oregon • Research Analyst, Center on Reinventing Public Education
I study how race and language shape educational opportunity through policy labels (e.g., English learner classification, TAG identification) and the systems that translate labels into course access and learning experiences. :contentReferenceoaicite:1

title: Janette Avelar
text:
Currently

Multilingual learners’ access to advanced coursework and how TAG identification shapes opportunity
Policy levers shaping course access (waiving services, extra instructional time, counselor availability)
Building open-access datasets on innovative school practices (The Canopy Project)

title: Current Projects
text: Below are current and recent projects. Each includes a short description plus outputs and methods.

title: Current Projects
text:
Invisible Choices in Overlooked Pathways (Dissertation)
How policy labels (e.g., English learner classification, TAG identification) shape students’ access to opportunity—and what happens beyond the label.
Outputs: CV (PDF) • (add: papers, slides, briefs)
Methods:
Administrative data MAIHDA Policy analysis

title: Current Projects
section: TAG identification as a lever for advanced coursework access
text:
TAG identification as a lever for advanced coursework access
Intersectional patterns in multilingual learners’ identification and downstream access to advanced coursework.
Outputs: (add: MLRC webinar slides / recording)
Methods:
MAIHDA Multilevel modeling Intersectionality

title: Current Projects
text:
Waiving English learner services
Prevalence, predictors, and estimated effects of waiving services on coursetaking and graduation.
Outputs: (add: AERA Open under review; policy briefs) :contentReferenceoaicite:2
Methods:
Longitudinal admin data Quasi-experimental Policy evaluation

title: Current Projects
text:
The Canopy Project (CRPE)
Open-access work on schoolwide practices in innovative learning environments; reports and briefs on trends and accountability.
Outputs: (add: report links + repo like canopyexplorer) :contentReferenceoaicite:3
Methods:
Survey + tagging Descriptive + mixed methods Open data products
